Legal_Issue: Whether the citizenship judge correctly applied the residence requirement under the Citizenship Act
Evidence_Type: Physical presence records, family ties, tax payments, work-related absences
Legal_Provision: Three years of residence in Canada within four years preceding application
Basis_of_Claim: Insufficient physical presence and failure to centralize mode of existence in Canada
Evaluation_Standard: Koo test for centralization of mode of existence
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Only 597 days of physical presence in Canada over four years
Application_Error: Failure to meet statutory residency requirement
Legal_Standard: Residence requirement under the Citizenship Act
Application_Factor: Family ties, tax payments, employment-related absences
Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient physical presence and lack of centralized mode of existence in Canada
Legal_Provision_Cited: Citizenship Act, section on residency requirement
Evidentiary_Issues: Extent and pattern of absences from Canada
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Application of Koo test by citizenship judge
Procedural_Issue: Standard of review in judicial review of citizenship decisions
Omission_Type: Failure to accumulate required residency days
